metadata.source: Perplexity MTC footnote research, confirmed against MTC.gov

resale_only_states._comment: These states ONLY accept the MTC Uniform Certificate for resale exemptions. Government, nonprofit, or other entity-based exemptions require state-specific forms or SST F0003.

AZ.restriction: Not for any other statutory deduction or exemption

RI.restriction: When item will be resold in same form

TN.restriction: May not be used for any other type of exemption
alternative_forms: TN state forms (RV-F1301301 gov, RV-F1306901 exempt org)

VT.restriction: Resale for goods only, not component parts to service. Not for contractors.

WA.restriction: Misuse may result in interest and penalties
WA.note: WA is less strict — accept MTC but add penalty warning note

registration_required_states._comment: These states require additional registration numbers when using the MTC form.

PA.requirement: Must include PA Sales and Use Tax license number

MD.requirement: Must include MD sales and use tax registration number

unconfirmed_states._comment: MTC acceptance status not directly confirmed for these states. Conservative approach: accept with note.

CT.note: Need direct verification of MTC acceptance for non-resale

DC.note: Need direct verification of MTC acceptance for non-resale

correction_template: MTC Uniform Certificate is accepted for resale exemptions only in {state}. Your entity-based exemption requires {alternative_forms}. Please resubmit using the appropriate form.
